message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product which has been meticulously designed to meet your needs. It comes with a comprehensive set of features that will significantly enhance your experience. Considering its value and quality, I propose a price of $15,000 for this product.

Alice, thank you for your offer. I appreciate the product's features, but $15,000 is a bit out of my budget. I'm willing to pay $12,000 for it. This price reflects the value I see in the product and is the maximum I can afford.

Thank you for your response, Bob. I understand your position and appreciate your willingness to pay a fair price for the product. To reach a mutually beneficial agreement, I would like to propose a price of $13,500 for the product.

Alice, I appreciate you meeting me halfway.  While I'm still interested, $13,500 is still a little high for me.  I'm prepared to pay $12,500.  This is a fair price that's closer to my budget and reflects the product's value.

Thank you for your continued interest, Bob. I've considered your offer carefully, and I'm pleased to counter with a price of $13,000 for the product. This price reflects a compromise between our positions while still allowing us to maintain a fair profit margin.

Alice, I appreciate your continued willingness to negotiate.  I'm still not quite there with $13,000, but I'm willing to go up to $12,750.  This price is a good compromise and reflects the value I see in the product.  I hope we can finalize a deal.

Thank you for your patience and flexibility, Bob. I understand your budget constraints and am willing to meet you halfway once more. I propose a final price of $12,875 for the product. This price allows us to reach an agreement that is fair for both parties.
